metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15642 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
In lsx_aiffstartread in aiff.c in Sound eXchange (SoX) 14.4.2, there is aUse-After-Free vulnerability triggered by supplying a malformed AIFF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15642` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsox-fmt-all - 14.4.2-3
libsox-fmt-alsa - 14.4.2-3
libsox-fmt-ao - 14.4.2-3
libsox-fmt-base - 14.4.2-3
libsox-fmt-mp3 - 14.4.2-3
libsox-fmt-oss - 14.4.2-3
libsox-fmt-pulse - 14.4.2-3
libsox3 - 14.4.2-3
sox - 14.4.2-3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: sox package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '14.4.2-3').
